forests.name: Ashley National Forest
forests.description: The Ashley National Forest, with headquarters in Vernal, Utah, comprises 1.3 million acres located in the northeastern portion of Utah and southwestern portion of Wyoming.

forests.name: Cherokee National Forest
forests.description: The 640,000-acre Cherokee National Forest is the largest tract of public land in Tennessee and lies in the heart of the Southern Appalachian mountain range, one of the world's most diverse areas.

forests.name: Colville National Forest
forests.description: The 1.1 million-acre Colville National Forest was first shaped more than 10,000 years ago by Ice Age glaciers that carved three major valleys of today's Columbia River.

forests.name: Uinta National Forest
forests.description: The unique mix of stunning geography, people and events have made the Uinta National Forest in Utah the incredible place it is today and will continue to carry it into the future.

forests.name: Olympic National Forest
forests.description: The Olympic National Forest is located on the Olympic Peninsula in the northwest corner of Washington State and includes five major landscape settings, including temperate rain forest, rugged mountains, lowland lakes, rivers, and coastal beaches.

forests.name: Fishlake National Forest
forests.description: The Fishlake National Forest in central Utah features majestic stands of aspen encircling open mountain meadows that are lush with a diverse community of forbs and grasses.

forests.name: Bighorn National Forest
forests.description: Located in north-central Wyoming, the Bighorn Mountains are a sister range of the Rocky Mountains. Conveniently located halfway between Mt. Rushmore and Yellowstone National Park, the Bighorns are a great vacation destination in themselves.
